source: An interactive campfire used to start a long rest for the party
The starting point for the party
An exit point for the party. Can lead to another user location
A door which requires a perception check to be spotted
A wall torch which can be dynamically lit/unlit
Stepping into this area will display a text
Generates one medium (or smaller) monster at the gadget position
Generates one large monster at the gadget position
Generates a number of medium (or smaller) monsters at the gadget position
A trap that is activated by stepping on the surface it occupies
An interaction displaying a lore text, which can be placed on any prop
A generic purpose loot interaction, which can be placed on any prop to simulate a container
Determines whether the content will be a predefined loot pack, or an explicit list of items
A predefined list of items, some of which will be rolled randomly
Specify an explicit list of items that will be spawned in the container
Determines whether this gadget is locked
The difficulty class to unlock this gadget
Determines whether this gadget is trapped
The difficulty class to spot the trap on this gadget
The difficulty class to disarm the trap on this gadget
The difficulty class to reveal this gadget
The type of effect that impacts the affected creatures when this trap is triggered
A location can be entered from several entry points. This index is used to specify the entrance an exit gadget leads to
The text that is displayed when interacting with this gadget
Check this to make the spawned creature part of an encounter group, triggering battles together
Creatures with an identical group index (any number you chose) will belong to the same encounter group
The difficulty class for the saving throw
Increase the number of dice for this effect
A hanging chandelier which can be damaged and cause fall damage
A metallic fence containing a collapsing metallic door
A visible plate which activates other gadgets when stepped on
A mural plaque used to provide lore to the player
An interactive lamp which becomes lit when targeted by magical spells
A metallic door closing/opening the access to a detention area
A button which can be used to activate other gadgets
Entering this area activates other gadgets
A plate which activates other gadgets when stepped on
An invisible gadget which activates other gadgets at regular timed intervals
The gadgets which will be triggered by this gadget's activation / deactivation
Can the activator be played back and forth, for example to open / close a door?
The type of operation performed on the target gadgets
Activate other gadgets (example : open a door)
Deactivate other gadgets (example: close a door)
Activate & deactivate back and forth (example: open & close a door)
Enabled an activator, so that it can activate other gadgets
Disables an activator which will no longer activate other gadgets (example: disable a timed activator)
Enables & disables back and forth (example: a button could enable & disable a timed activator)
This gadget cannot be opened by normal means, an remote activator is required to open it
Determines if this gadget is lit by default or unlit if the option is checked off.
Determines if this gadget is opened by default
Generates one huge monster at the gadget position
Generates one gargantuan monster at the gadget position
When this option is off, spawning the monster requires a remote activator, instead of the proximity of heroes
The form in which lore information is presented to the user
The content is displayed as banter over the head of the first conscious character in the party
The content is displayed as banter over the head of a random conscious party member and disappears after the duration
The content is displayed at the triggering gadget's position
The content appears at the top of the screen in large-character font and disappears after the duration
The content is displayed on a panel at the bottom of the screen and disappears after the duration
The content is displayed on a panel in the center of the screen, which remains visible until the user has acknowledged it
A block that can be pushed one cell by a character
A hanging stalactite that can be damaged and cause fall damage
If this option is checked, the lore information is displayed only once when the gadget is triggered
An activator that is triggered when the location is entered. Since this gadget does not react to character positions or interactions, it can be placed anywhere in a room
If this option is checked, the lore information is displayed only once when the gadget is triggered
This gadget will display lore when triggered by an activator gadget (e.g. an Entry Activator). It can be placed in any free space as it is invisible and non-interactive
Determines if this activator is activated by default
The object is opened automatically if the party is carrying this item
A destructible foliage that blocks the way
A trunk of tree that can be pushed forward
A strange flower that will explode when damaged or when a player approach it.
A strange flower that will explode in flames when damaged or when a player approach it.
A list of additional items dropped by the creature when it is killed
